sect1.title: section,sectionelse

row.entry: Value to determine the number of loop iterations

The index position that the section will begin looping. If the value is negative, the start position is calculated from the end of the array. For example, if there are seven values in the loop array and start is -2, the start index is 5. Invalid values (values outside of the length of the loop array) are automatically truncated to the closest valid value.
The step value that will be used to traverse the loop array. For example, step=2 will loop on index 0,2,4, etc. If step is negative, it will step through the array backwards.
Sets the maximum number of times the section will loop.
determines whether or not to show this section

sect1.para: Template sections are used for looping over arrays of data. All section tags must be paired with /section tags. Required parameters are name and loop. The name of the section can be anything you like, made up of letters, numbers and underscores. Sections can be nested, and the nested section names must be unique from each other. The loop variable (usually an array of values) determines the number of times the section will loop. When printing a variable within a section, the section name must be given next to variable name within brackets []. sectionelse is executed when there are no values in the loop variable.

example.title: sectionelse

sect1.para: Sections also have their own variables that handle section properties. These are indicated like so: {$smarty.section.sectionname.varname}

note.para: As of Smarty 1.5.0, the syntax for section property variables has been changed from {%sectionname.varname%} to {$smarty.section.sectionname.varname}. The old syntax is still supported, but you will only see reference to the new syntax in the manual examples.

sect2.title: index
sect2.para: index is used to display the current loop index, starting with zero (or the start attribute if given), and incrementing by one (or by the step attribute if given.)

note.title: Technical Note
note.para: If the step and start section properties are not modified, then this works the same as the iteration section property, except it starts on 0 instead of 1.

sect2.title: index_prev
sect2.para: index_prev is used to display the previous loop index. on the first loop, this is set to -1.

example.title: section property index_prev
example.screen:
0 id: 1000
The customer id changed
1 id: 1001
The customer id changed
2 id: 1002
The customer id changed

sect2.title: index_next
sect2.para: index_next is used to display the next loop index. On the last loop, this is still one more than the current index (respecting the setting of the step attribute, if given.)

example.title: section property index_next
example.screen:
0 id: 1000
The customer id will change
1 id: 1001
The customer id will change
2 id: 1002
The customer id will change

sect2.title: iteration
sect2.para: iteration is used to display the current loop iteration.

note.para: This is not affected by the section properties start, step and max, unlike the index property. Iteration also starts with 1 instead of 0 like index. rownum is an alias to iteration, they work identical.

example.title: section property iteration
example.screen:
current loop iteration: 1 5 id: 1000
The customer id will change
current loop iteration: 2 7 id: 1001
The customer id will change
current loop iteration: 3 9 id: 1002
The customer id will change

sect2.title: first
sect2.para: first is set to true if the current section iteration is the first one.

sect2.title: last
sect2.para: last is set to true if the current section iteration is the last one.

sect2.title: rownum
sect2.para: rownum is used to display the current loop iteration, starting with one. It is an alias to iteration, they work identically.

sect2.title: loop
sect2.para: loop is used to display the last index number that this section looped. This can be used inside or after the section.

example.title: section property index
example.screen:
0 id: 1000
1 id: 1001
2 id: 1002
There were 3 customers shown above.

sect2.title: show
sect2.para: show is used as a parameter to section. show is a boolean value, true or false. If false, the section will not be displayed. If there is a sectionelse present, that will be alternately displayed.

example.title: section attribute show
example.screen:
1 id: 1000
2 id: 1001
3 id: 1002
the section was shown.

sect2.title: total
sect2.para: total is used to display the number of iterations that this section will loop. This can be used inside or after the section.

example.title: section property total
example.screen:
0 id: 1000
2 id: 1001
4 id: 1002
There were 3 customers shown above.
